Reviews.Title: “OK - but very hot rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bethan C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Legacy Ottoman in April, when the weather in Istanbul was cool. But the rooms were incredibly hot even with the air-con on (several other colleagues stayed in other rooms in the hotel and had the same problem). It was like a sauna and I was concerned that I wouldn't be able to sleep. There was no hot water on one of the days we stayed (we only stayed three nights). The hotel is very central and the staff were helpful. Breakfast was fine and the wi-fi was good and consistent. Had room service one night and that the food was good and came quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary, VERY GOOD Hotel for an Istanbul City-Trip”
Reviews.Author: Fenerfan
Reviews.Content: This nice and luxurious hotel is located very CENTRAL (ca. 100 m) near the city-tram-station Sirkeci; so you`ll find it without searching around, when when you arrive from the airport. All sightseeing-highlights are reacheable in only a few minutes by foot (ca. 10-15 min. in all directions) and although the boat-stations are very nearby. Rooms and service are really more than o.k.; the breakfast for a turkish-breakfast good. The stuff ist very friendly and best of all to qur opinion was the front office management! We got a very friendly and excellent help for all our questions and wishes (--> ....so for an example the leading front office manager, Ms. Ã–nkuzu, ordered us tickets for an instesting footballmatch of a turkish top-club !!!!) and they live really "the guest ist our king" !!! Our visit in this hotel was basic for a very very nice holiday-trip in istanbul. Thank you very much !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, filthy bathroom, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: arciboldi
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is becoming more expensive than Paris ! 120 euros for a room in Istanbul is this '5 stars' hotel...The building has a beautiful architecture, being built around 1900 in an Art Nouveau-Ottomano-Mauresque style (and not XIVth century, as they tell you at the booking agency in the airport). The facade is old, but the bulding inside is new. Take the subway the connect with the tram, refuse the shuttle because it's a nightmare to drive through the city. Or jump from the minibus when you reach the tram line and take it, it's much faster. The location is close to Topkapi, Galata Brigde and to the ferries at Eminonu. Tram stop right behind. The lobby has a kitchy feel, big as a train station, high chandeliers, polished marble and grotesque golden armchairs. Some rooms have windows opening in this lobby, you don't want to book that ! Staff relatively helpful, but not very smart. We had to repeat a few times that we want a quiet room, on a higher floor (they kept offering us 1st floor). The room is BIG !. Beautiful proportions, high ceillings. We had 3 arched windows, separated by pillars. Not very good sound insulation, but the area is not noisy, it's rather dead at night. Open view, overlooking a mosque and a cemetery, quite atmospheric. Some stains on the carpet. Good quality bedding and sheets, like in international hotels. Pleasant, overall, elegant. The bad surprise was the bathroom ! Mold stains between the tiles. Yellow stains on the tub and the sink. Every narrow corner was dirty. Really unhygienic and disgusting. Have they heard of scrubbing brushes? The breaksfast is on the top floor, in a warehouse-sized space. Abundant but not refined. Cheeses and raw vegetables mostly. The waiters keep taking away your plate while you go to pour coffee. When you come back, there is nothing left where you were eating. And this happens constantly. Decoration here is horrific, like a cheap disco, but some view over the Golden Horn, on top of the roofs.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, hot, loud”
Reviews.Author: ICHermes
Reviews.Content: The bed was uncomfortable, old and dirty. There was a brown stain on the bedding as well. I would think you could through out sheets when feces won't come out of them. The heating and air conditioning does not work. The Wifi is miserable. The food caused one person in our party to get sick. The location was decent. It was near some fun things, cool little shops, and the like. This was my second stay in Istanbul and this hotel was horrible compared to the first.

Reviews.Title: “Please someone take over !”
Reviews.Author: Dirk3061
Reviews.Content: Good central location and glorious entry hall, but that's it. Old rooms (though spacious) and incredibly lousy service. Took us 30 minutes to check out for 5 people... Needs serious investment in property and management.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...nothing exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: AlexP84
Reviews.Content: The overall impression is very far from a 5 stars hotel. The unique "pro" is the fantastic location in Sultanhamet, the very center of the city, nearby the main spots (Hagia Sofia, Topkapi, Bazaar, Yerebatan Sarayi...) which can be reached in no more that 10 mins walking. The 5 stars are justified only for the magnificent and luxurious common areas (particularly the hall, the restaurant, located at the 6th floor, and offering a fantastic view on the Bosforus, and the spa). The room was really small and the only window was inside the hotel, over the reception. Therefore there was no possibility of having air ricirculation or natural light. Globally the temperature was innaturally hot, especially because the room thermostat did not work. In other rooms there was not hot water, and no one was able to solve this problem in 4 days. At last, a really simple but unpleasant problem: the room electronic keys did not work very often, so we had to go upstairs and downstairs many times before opening our room! Globally, the main conclusion is the bad prize-quality ratio!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: teresa-nieves
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 5 stars if not more. The property is gorgeous and the the staff is exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “great spaces,but not a hotel for those who need handholding”
Reviews.Author: laluce81
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location by the Spice market.Beautifully restored old building with Ottoman furnished lobby, a classic large cage elevator, wide halls, high ceiling spacious rooms,,excellent value. Breakfast is extensive Hamam shows its age but the massuer is delightful and very professional. Best to book thru Istanbulhotels.com Use them for all transfers and other related services ..

Reviews.Title: “Everything a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: mediawise
Reviews.Content: As some other reviews have said, this hotel should be rated much higher than it is. We stayed 3 nights. We were very pleasantly surprised by the large, modern room which was waiting for us when we opened the door. Check in was business like and professional, but it is a large business hotel frequented by groups. We had a small problem with the room which was fixed within minutes of our call for service. The breakfast is extensive served in a room with a view. We found the elevators uncrowded, lobby beautiful and clean, and the room spacious by big city hotel standards. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to TA readers. It is in a prime location next to the Spice Market with plenty of shopping and sites within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: Alybaba786
Reviews.Content: Good location, and lots of potential. Poorly maintained, indifferent service. Rooms are tired and poorly maintained. Took multiple requests to get basics like soap and shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Jannette55
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit...The reason of our return was the hotel's staff, they make us to feel comfortable like we're home! We thank reservation department employees specially Ms. Sevcan and others who they were really helpful and kind. In the breakfast room very nice ladies with great hospitality. For us the most important thing is to feel welcomed, which the hotel's staff are well trained and friendly. Soon, we are going to be in Istanbul and I'm sure that we will book a room in Legacy Ottoman Hotel without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Legacy Ottoman Hotel of Istanbul is an architectural gem!”
Reviews.Author: George F
Reviews.Content: I was rather concerned about some of the reviews I read about this hotel before booking my reservation there, but went ahead and took a chance because of its ideal location in the cultural center of Istanbul. I was very pleasantly surprised when I was actually there (I spent a total of 9 nights). The hotel is actually very nicely kept and has a wonderful spa and their breakfast (included) is delightful. All I can say is that most of the unflattering reviews I read about this hotel are grossly exaggerated, and probably vindictive in nature; maybe even by the same individual or individuals involved. Who knows; the hotel and its staff are wonderful. I strongly recommend it to any one desiring to stay in a classy hotel in the center of Istanbul's cultural district.

Reviews.Title: “AC hot and bad service”
Reviews.Author: hamdanaldossary
Reviews.Content: Internet Poor their service bad( adapter requested five times, every time they say you will receive) i complained about that the air conditioning Does not function well The answer is what can I do We apologize!! good breakfast furniture Above the average

Reviews.Title: “"Never never never again...”
Reviews.Author: Apostolos N
Reviews.Content: It is by far the worst 5star I have ever being. Thank got for the existance of internet so maybe some tourists can be saved from these terible hotels. Anyway, the 5 stars , strats and ends at the lobby. Remember that. Dirty rooms, unpolite service, and a miserable hotel. Location is great, but who cares if it is to be staying at this ahura. I took a standard room, was so small I though i died . I changed to a suite, paying 300 euros per day. You will not believe the mess of the suite. Old and dirty... No wi-fi ofcourse... I discovered the router, was a zyxel hanging upside down in the corridor...lol . Also breakfast is terrible. And the view is good (from top floor) but the floor has a smell , i dont know what it is... Anyway. Keep away!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Jkhayyat
Reviews.Content: We, the group, found the overall sevice was very bad. Some of the rooms were very smaal. The bathrooms arevsmall as well. The watervis mot clean, rusty most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Far below expectations”
Reviews.Author: ErtanU
Reviews.Content: To ceep the review crisp, I quite frequently travel to Istanbul and change downtown hotels regularly. This was amongst the worst experiences so far. Lets keep it crisp: - entrance and architecture is very nice, but thats about it - staff appears to be neither friendly nor competent - breakfast had a nice first appearance but lacked of quality and freshness - we had used, wet towels + bathrobe at room entering - room had a nice view, but an awfull old and bad smell - aircondition has a thermostat which does not work. Either it is too cold or too hot - water was rusty - no shuttle service to airports on sundays - last but not least: I know I had left my mobile in the room safe, which according to reception and manager housekeeping could not be found: trustworthy personnel - most taxi drivers do not know the place and which is somewhat awkward My personal remark for Mr. Budak, General Manager of Legacy Ottoman: copy-pasting standard replies at Tripadvisor is just the perfect reflaction of your hotels maturity levels and importance of guest service. From my angle the new management team which you proclaim was not successful in reacting on the criticism and returning results to positively influence guest perception. Summary: a wannabe five star with little hope. I can grant its possible to find better places at lower rates smilarly located at the heart of Istanbul Ertan U.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious would go back anytime!!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine2000
Reviews.Content: I found the Head Concierge whose name is Voltan very very helpful and caring. As I did not speak the language and yet wanted to get to see the sights , he kindly gave me his personal mobile fone number for me to call in case I ran into any problems...language or otherwise. The staff were so polite and helpful and the places that they recommended that I visit were great.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather consider a different place”
Reviews.Author: fringillae
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of this hotel is its location close to the main (north shore) railway station, the Galata bridge and to many restaurants. Most attractions and the most picturesque part of the old city, though, are 15 minutes uphill. This hotel has all you would expect from a 4* hotel but... if you look around, you won't be able to tell whether you're in Beijing, Houston or Istanbul. This brings me to the main drawback: this place full of glimmer and glitter just has no soul at all. For almost half the price you can get a much warmer welcome and a nice place that really make you feel at home in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel i have ever been”
Reviews.Author: afra_heidar
Reviews.Content: I am sending this email to inform you that I have stayed from 3th June till 7th June at legacy ottoman hotel, and I have paid 700 Euro for 4 nights but unfortunately at the day u have checked out and deliver my luggage to the hotel luggage room, my wallet with 1300 Euro has been stolen at that hotel and no one helped me to find my money while just 2 or 3 persons at that hotel have had the luggage room key, the worst thing was that after stealing my money they did not give me a car to take me to the airport , my flight was on 9.30PM but they said your agent who booked this hotel for you must take you to the airport I said I am surprising I have paid 700 Euro to you just for having the high level security at your hotel and good services , and you know my money has been stolen at your hotel but you did not want to send me to the airport, since I have spent all of my money in my bag I just have had 1TL in my bag and while I wanted to take more money from my luggage I understood that they have stolen my money, I went there as a tourist just to visit your country and I was alone since they did not give me a car I arrived so late to the airport and I missed out my flight and I forced to borrow money from my agent at the airport who booked this hotel for me, it s shame on this hotel and I am sorry that no one was there to help me even I asked the hotel manager to give me the police No for help he said I donâ€™t know the police number, I ask them to give me a reasonable response that how they have taken my money in a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central pleasant Legacy Ottoman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: artnuvo
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 twin room on the 5th floor by the front elevator for 3 nights during the last week of April. The room was clean and spacious; beds were firm which is typical in Turkey. The bathroom was large and modern but the shower wall was grungy and should have been cleaned. Common areas are 5* quality, rooms are 3*+. Hotel staff is friendly, internet is free in the lobby, and breakfasts are generous and quite a nice spread. The hotel is very central as Sultanhamet is a 10 minute walk and en route you will pass the Archeological Museum where you can find Alexander Great's tomb and a separate and delightful Tile Museum. There is a well known and great pastry shop on the corner. You are also within a 5 minute walk to the Galata bridge, a tram stop, and the railroad station next to the tram which has some art nouveau traces and where the Orient Express departed. Overall, there is a nice hotel for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: LuvTraveling8
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel! Huge rooms, clean, very elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, cold reception and chaotic breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: Uglyduck71
Reviews.Content: An impressive lobby welcomes you, and a porter will help you with your bags, but it's downhill from there on in. The people on reception are cold and over-formal which does not reflect typical Turkish hospitality. We were shown to our room, which was already occupied. We then had to return to the lobby, which was still impressive, where we had to wait half an hour before being given a room. The new room had hairs in the bath, nice. The TV switched itself on and off at random times, told staff - who did nothing. Breakfast room was tired and the view of the Bosphorous is through very dirty windows. People fight for the tables near the window and there is no guidance from staff, who are busy clearing tables, slowly. Does not live up to a 5 star expectation, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redwine127
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one brief night here whilst passing through Istanbul. Hotel has impressive facade and entrance lobby is very grand. My room was tired but acceptable. Unfortunately the maid hadn't removed the previous guests half used shampoo from the shower and the note pad next to my bed had been used with scribbles on. Small things but not acceptable when paying Â£120 for one night. I arrived at the hotel about 10pm and went straight to the roof bar which was virtually empty but had a stunning view of the city and Bosphorous. (But so have many hotels in Istabul) Bar /restaurant manager was very friendly and helpful. The hotel site says the Blue Mosque is 500 yds away - this is simply not true, its a 15-20 minute walk up hill. Possibly a mile away. Didn't eat at the hotel. Reception staff were helpful. Didn't spend long enough here to give a fuller opinion but generally thought it a good place to stay, reasonable location and near market. Would I consider staying here again, yes possibly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, stay away”
Reviews.Author: margarita_bagrova
Reviews.Content: My review is overdue, as all this time I didnt want to remember a single moment of my stay in this hotel, just because I am searching now new hotels and read different reviews - I have decided finally to share my personal experience, as it is unfair to keep it only with my angry clients and myself. In Sept 2009 I did big business group of my client with accomodation and conference in this hotel, stayed for 4 nights there. Unfortunatelly I didnt have possibility to come for inspection trip, otherwise I would never chose it. This is never ever 5 star hotel!! The service is soooo poor. The staff hardly understand and speak any English languadge. Room service: I personally ordered room service, they forgot about me, despite we were the only big group at this time and should be priority level. Same service was with my rest clients. SPA: I booked SPA for morning, before my flight to relax after work nightmare and they mix the time, did the booking on evening. The SPA itself very wierd, with very small pool , cold and turkish man staff watch you .. Brrrr. This can`t not happend in the hotel. Lost property: I asked to move me from one room with no day light to another, while moving I forgot the jamper. In 30 min later I asked the reception to bring it to me, but they coundnt, as it has disappered after immediate room cleaning. Little thieves! Breakfast: terrible food, no taste, bad service. The only good thing - great view from restaurant to the port area. But this cant compensate other emotions. Restaurant service: there was big scandal in restaurant with my clients. As the English of the staff was so bad - they brought different food order, made wrong bill, and moreover it was all sooooo slow. Conference facilities: quite poor for 5 star hotel. I would expect this conference room in 3 or 4 ecomony hotel. I ordered sound assistant from hotel. This person knew 3 English words, despite was sold to me as English speaking person... Rooms: They all of different size, as I saw about 30 rooms before group arrival. Some are very small, like broom closet, some are nice with view. But by tiles, bath tab, carpet etc - you can classify the hotel. Not 5 star at all. There were other minor touches as well. But suppose this is quite enought to make impression of this 5 star hotel. Please, dont do my mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended: 5Star lobby, 1 star food, 2 star service; Disputed bill”
Reviews.Author: Business-Ireland
Reviews.Content: Visiting with a group of colleagues for business meetings I found this place to be managed like a 2 star regional Turkish Hotel... As a guest I felt the staff thought had no understanding of my needs and expectations, and seemed only intent on selling expensive drinks and extras. Despite my insitence that it was prepaid, they charged me for an extra night which my parent company says was already prepaid, and overcharged me even for that. Another colleague is disputing a c.$1000 bill for dinner at a restaurant that the concierge recommended. The location is great for access to historic sites and the super markets. Half way throhgh the week some of my colleagues were dodging the hotel lunch (prepaid) and going to the kebab stand down the road!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeK9
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel luxurious near the Spice Bazaar, big and cosy rooms.... huge and tasteful breakfast

Reviews.Title: “One of the best 5* hotel we stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Masood
Reviews.Content: We actually went to this trip in Aug 2009. We have stayed in many 5* hotel & this as the best! We booked a double room but it was tooo small, so we asked for a up grade & they gave us corner suite, it was soo beautiful!!highly recommended for honeymoon couples. The spa & hamman is also great after a hard day of sight seeing & shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Old lady with promise”
Reviews.Author: TravelbeeSantaFe_NM
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gotten a bum rap recently. It is conveniently located, just steps from the Spice Market and walking distance to the Post Office, the Bospherous and other sites, in a real old city neighborhood. We didn't have the water, service, mold problems of others and found the breakfasts perfectly acceptable for the buffet-afficianado. If you can negotiate a good rate, go for it, but it's not worth more than $120. Our room had a great view, as did the dining area. What is odd about Turkey is that once they decide it is winter, they shut off the air conditioning. Nevertheless, once you open the windows at nightfall, the cool air flows in and the sounds of the call to prayer.

Reviews.Title: “"Delta Dawn"”
Reviews.Author: Litoguti
Reviews.Content: The Legacy Ottoman Hotel may have been "Five Stars" at one time. Right now is nothing more than "a faded rose from days gone by. . ." (Delta Dawn anyone?). While the staff was most accomodating to our complaints, there is little one can do with a poorly responsive structure, both badly maintained and serviced. Our housekeeper was not cleaning the room, in which we stayed for six day, in accordance to the standards we would expect from a Marriott. The food, while edible, was of the poorest quality in the entire trip. There is nothing appealing about stuffed chicken breast for two nights in a row. The breakfast buffet was so tired!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good location, however some of its stars are tarnished.”
Reviews.Author: traveller181
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very nice location near the tram stop and the Galata Bridge. Staff was nice and friendly and do a great job. Just up the street Efes is 5 Tlr for .5 Ltr. When we turned on the shower, the water came out very brown. Not appealing. Obviously the room we had, had not been rented for some time. The hotel is supposed to be a 4 or 5 star, however some of the stars are tarnished.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: marzia27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located and has a grand entrance. Everything changes when you enter your room. We were given half a suite on 5th floor (No 531). The view from the bedroom was not exciting: roofs and pigeons. The bathroom had a huge jacuzzi type bath BUT the tap was far away from the bath (!) and, if you wanted to wash yourself, you had to remove the shower head, sit or kneel in the middle of the bath, and hold it! Absolutely incredible. Moreover, there was no extractor and it got all steamed up. My husband tried to have a bath and water started to come from underneath the bath, so he had to mop it. The service is non existent. Do not ask for a wake up call because they will not call you anyway. Breakfast is basic: plenty of salty cheeses and rock hard pastries. No covers on food.

Reviews.Title: “BAD EXPERIENCE...STAY AWAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AND_CHR
Reviews.Content: The location is the only thing let's say good of this hotel, the rest is a nightmare. The room was terrible dirty, the bathroom was small and full of mold, the minibar was not cleaned for at least 1 month, the restaurant...hmmmm...poor and dirty also the food was old and not tasty at all. They told us that the hotel has a parking place but our car in 2 days was moved 10 times around the hotel and it was also scratched. We wanted to leave after 10 minutes we have reached the room but they took the money in advance. THE CONCLUSION IS : IF I WANT TO BE POLITE I'LL SAY THAT THE HOTEL IS NOT MORE THAN 2* CATEGORY!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the website”
Reviews.Author: Joula
Reviews.Content: The building is beautiful but not pleasant. Its an old palace. Staff are friendly Cleanliness: below average . restaurant smells bad. its not easy to arrive Istanbul first day and stay there - the area is great to visit but not live in. we left the hotel the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Just donÂ´t go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carlie29
Reviews.Content: Not only we were very disappointment with the hotel in general...rooms,pool(which was even discusting),but the service and the treatment given by the personal was terrible.(slow,not efficent at all,completly desinterested by the customerÂ´s needs)Air conditioner not working properly(the city is extremely warm and wet),rooms partianely cleaned(not even the sheets are changed)..etc. ItÂ´s closer to a three stars hotel than a five stars one.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, very good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Max0031
Reviews.Content: This hotel will give you a good price for good quality. The location is very good; 10 minute walk to the highlights such as the blue mosque and galata bridge. It is located in a busy street, but not much noise during the night. Rooms may differ; it seems that some have been renovated but others haven't. My room on the 1st was huge with a very comfortable bed. Free wireless on request. Many hotels in the area, f.e. some Best Western, will not give you this price-quality.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience,”
Reviews.Author: TNV
Reviews.Content: Did not live up to the last of the 5 stars. Hotel looks great and is in the middle of the town, just across from train station. Room was not in great condition, needed a good spring clean out. We had problems with the bath and shower which they did not manage to solve during our stay so was a bit disapointing overall - Not great value. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “I had paid in advance for the room but still walked out!”
Reviews.Author: Christadn
Reviews.Content: Do NOT, NOT stay here! The only thing I enjoyed about this hotel was the polite staff at the front desk - when it was actually staffed! The exterior of the hotel and the lobby are clean and pretty but that's where it ends! Our hotel room (a corner suite) was a colletion of stained carpets, peeling wall paper and molding grout in the bathroom. The furniture was tacky and as stained as the carpet. And I counted five rusting nails sticking an inch out of the walls around where it looked like a baseboard had once been mounted. When I tried to take a shower, the water came out - without exaggeration - the color of English breakfast tea. After letting it run for 15 minutes, I finally called the front desk and they sent someone up who, 10 minutes later, came up to the same color water coming out the spout and told me to "Just let it run. Cold water, okay, hot water, not so good". Well, I'm not sure how long it needs to run to clear up, but 45 minutes into it, I finally took a freezing and only slightly brownish shower. The "bar" and restaurant on the top (6th) floors are mediocre at best and, like the rooms, in desparate need of renovation. Please don't be fooled by the 5-star rating (I don't know who they paid off to achieve that!!). This is a two star at best and I, quite literally have stayed in cleaner hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Hotel under a Five Star Hood”
Reviews.Author: MomentNow
Reviews.Content: The reception was grande but unfortunately that was probably the only thing living up to the hotel's 5 star rating. However the receiptionist was cold-faced and lacked the welcoming warmth. The rooms were ancient (not the ancient character, but in terms of facility and maintainance), staff were very keen to receive tips. We were given a room which had windows opening to the inside well, that looked great at the beginning but then you'll realise it is extremely noisy as you can easily hear the people talking downstairs (we were on 3rd floor) at nights. Unfortunately you'll have to leave the windows open as the rooms were quite warm (complete with a damp smell) and the aircon was too noisy for us to leave it on over night. The bathroom was more like a budget hotel with yellow stains on the bathtub. Given there are so many other hotels in Istanbul, I'm sure you'll find a much better one with the same sort of budget (and we certainly did not pay the ticker price!).

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: JmanPrague
Reviews.Content: I wished I had consulted this site before staying at the Legacy Ottoman. The air conditioning didn't work, like many previous reviewers have pointed out. Now I see why the reception didn't seem at all fazed when I complained about it, obviously they are used to hearing it! The location is only "good" in the sense that it is central, but the actual street the hotel is on is chaotic, loud, and dirty, all of which becomes all too evident when you have to sleep with the window open because the air conditioning doesn't work. Walking back home late at night didn't feel safe at all. Istanbul has areas that are just as central and much more pleasant to stay in, such as the Sultanahmet district. The hotel would've been fine had it been half the price, but at their current rates it is ridiculously over-priced. Lastly, air conditioning issues aside, it doesn't even come close to it's supposed 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service with dishonesty.”
Reviews.Author: Abrar
Reviews.Content: Although i did not stay here, I was walking past and wanted to exchange some money. The doorman first said that they did not exchange money. When I questioned this, his response was that they only did so for customers. He then asked how much I wanted to exchange, saw that he had the approximate amount of Lira and offered to do the exchange - at a rate very advantageous to him! A little later, I passed again and the doorman was not at the door. So, I went to reception to ask about exchanging money. The first response was that they did not have any money (very believable!). Then the doorman turned up and said something in Turkish. Reception's response became that they only exchanged money for those staying at the hotel. These experiences suggest a very poor attitude to potential customers, outright dishonesty and at least one doorman would tried to make some money on the side. I might once have been a potential customer but not now. There are plenty of good hotels in Istanbul who provide a better service. I suggest you consider one of them before this one.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: guarkest
Reviews.Content: I HAD A DOUBT BEFORE COME. But after I stayed two nights in Legacy Ottoman Hotel all my doubts are gone. I think hotel ,services and staff are quite good for this rate. I need t high light that BEST LOCATION especially for the one who wants to stay in old city area. I continue my journey to history in Lovely Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience-Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: BobK1654
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as part of a tour group of 39. I was committed for 1 night and rented for an additional 2 nights. after checking-in. I read all the negative reviews and was very surprised and pleased when I arrived. As impressive the lobby is, the room didn't disappoint. Our room was clean, large with a big double bed, and decent-sized bathroom. Room was serviced and cleaned everyday in a timely manner. Free Internet available in the Business Room in the Lobby. Staff was helpful whenever I needed assistance. Breakfast was satisfying with lots of choices; although typically not my kind of food I certainly found enough to satisfy me. Hotel was undergoing renovation while we were there and new carpets were being laid in all the hallways and rooms. Can't ask for a more central location between transportaion, shopping, restaurants, & food outlets. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, friendly, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: clairebear44
Reviews.Content: I was taken to this hotel on a surprise trip, so I had no preconceptions and am also not sure of the prices involved. I know that it definitely wasn't a budget hotel but it was brilliant. It was booked thinking we had no breakfast, however we did have breakfast included (you probably could just go up to the breakfast buffee though as nobody checks your room number). The initial room we were given was quite small and dark, the hotel staff happily changed our room on the second night and the new room was much improved. large, light, airy and with an amazingly comfy bed!! All staff were very friendly, polite and spoke very good English The Spa was nice too, although the pool was pretty cold and it says there is a jacuzzi but it is infact in the pool, which is cold so its not much fun to spend more than about 2 minutes in there! Hotel was in a fantastic location close to all of the sights and amenities you could need. We made the transfer from Sabia Airport by bus (E10) and then Ferry from Kadikoy to Eminonu (it is about a 2min walk from the port at Eminonu) which cost us about 3-4 Lira in total. Also, take a look at www.havas.com.tr as they do very convenient, affordable and fast transfers, we caught ours back from Taksim but there may be one closer to Eminonu. From Taksim is was 13 Lira each and took about 35mins with buses leaving once every half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lousy hotel - not 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: PapasmurfLondon
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect, right in the middle of everything. The hotel is supposedly 5-star but, beyond the lobby it is 3-4 star at best. The rooms were small, had no view and the air conditioning did not work, which resulted in having to keep the window open at night (as a result got woken up at 4am on Friday morning by the call to prayer from the nearby mosque!). The water coming out of the shower was brown! Spa looks nice in the photos but was clearly re-furbed a few years ago with the steam room not working, the gym being extremely hot, the jacuzzi being swimming pool temperature but worst of all the hammam stinking of mould (which could be seen all over the ceiling!). Worst part of stay was, on asking for reception to arrange a taxi to the airport we seemed to get the porter's mate in his own car, who first wanted to drop us off only near the airport and then wanted us to pay him before arriving at the drop-off as he was concerned that the police would tell him off for being an illegal taxi. NOT what you would expect from a 5-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Sunset71
Reviews.Content: This is a five stars hotel. When entering to the lobby people can be positively impressed because of the luxury around the ground floor. My experience was not good on average since I was struggling with a room with not air conditioning almost at the beginning of the summer. I was complaining during two days until the manager gave me another room. That means that for two days my stay there was negatively affected by the air-conditioning problem. All in all, to me this hotel was very dark, I couldn't enjoy of nice views from the two rooms assigned to me. The restaurant was ok but not really special considering that this is a five stars hotel. I would recommend other hotels around the Sultanhamet area but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust the appearance you get from the web site.”
Reviews.Author: Zeikki
Reviews.Content: Looks far better in the web than in location. A run down place that needs renovation badly. If you are not too picky, the price performance is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great front desk”
Reviews.Author: iqaiqa16
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel as an Excellent hotel. I stayed for 5 days, enjoyed them to top. every thing went well, and will work if you're dealing with the right guy, for me I was only dealing with Pakin and Serhat. in the front desk, Excellent Language skills, with a professional smile that makes your day, and great handling with troubles (which happening every where). Pakin Helped me a lot, Advised me where and how to go, solved the Problems overall. I can't say any thing but thank you. The Location of the hotel is over discretion, just close to all transportation in Istanbul. One negative thing is the stupid policy of not removing alcohol from Rooms, I think admin can't hear Families with Babes complaining about children could open and use alcohol.

Reviews.Title: “Great loby small rooms”
Reviews.Author: cbwsydney
Reviews.Content: Satyed at the hotel for 7 nights, Hotel itself is quite grand but rooms are small and air cond did not work in rooms even after we moved rooms and it was the start of winter. Attitude of staff was good except for the day manager who quite frankly did not give a shi- also seem to mostly have twin share beds only

HotelInfo.Name: Legacy Ottoman Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hobyar Mahallesi Hamidiye Caddesi No:64, Istanbul 34112, Turkey
